definition: to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn

sentences.english: But in general Americans are warier of government than of capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 然而，美国民众警惕政府，多于警惕资本主义。

sentences.english: But in general Americans are warier of government than of capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 然而，美国民众警惕政府，多于警惕资本主义。

sentences.english: Be vigilant against the danger of enemy agents infiltrating the government and boring from within.
sentences.chinese: 警惕敌特渗入政府内部进行暗中破坏。

sentences.english: For instance, the country's territory still needs to be unified and it should be alert about national separatism.
sentences.chinese: 比如其领土还未实现统一，仍然要警惕民族分裂主义。

sentences.english: Yes, all of us writers need to guard against extravagating.
sentences.chinese: 是的，所有作家都要警惕不要逾越了这个界线。

sentences.english: Leo will respect Virgo's clever and alert mentality.
sentences.chinese: 狮子座能尊重处女座的机智及警惕。

sentences.english: Healing the sacroiliac joint takes constant vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 骶髂关节的治疗需要时刻保持警惕。

sentences.english: A security guard, waiting for the signal to zhao WeiZi continues the eighth route army.
sentences.chinese: 保安队放松警惕，八路军则继续等待赵家圩子的信号。

sentences.english: The night watchmen who apprehended the thief was praised for his vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 捉住小偷的守夜人因其警惕性而受到人们的赞扬。

sentences.english: We must guard against and redress all forms of covert protectionist activities.
sentences.chinese: 要警惕和纠正形形色色的隐性保护主义行为。

sentences.english: When the dog is alert, the orifices turn forward and the outer edges are vertical.
sentences.chinese: 当他警惕时，耳朵向前转，外侧边缘垂直。

sentences.english: ONE of the biggest dangers beachgoers are being urged to look out for this summer is rips.
sentences.chinese: 这个夏天海滩漫步者最大的危险是被迫警惕巨浪。

sentences.english: Our friends give us warnings against danger.
sentences.chinese: 朋友提醒我们警惕险难。

sentences.english: It was the spy's suspicious manner that first put us on to him.
sentences.chinese: 最初引起我们对这个间谍警惕的是他的可疑的举止。

sentences.english: We must not let down our vigilance against the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不可放松对敌人的警惕性。

sentences.english: The Chelsea boss is also wary of the Toon Army effect.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西教练很警惕纽卡斯尔军团的影响。

definition: to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
to be on guard/wariness/to guard against/preventive
treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard
to be mindful/to pay attention to/to take note of
to remind/to call attention to/to warn of
to be careful/to pay attention to
